page.title: 11BENINGTON SCHOOL (2)
page.content: It would accommodate 28 boys, 42 girls and 50 infants. Today the name has changed to Benington J.M.I. School but the building although having undergone considerable structur- al alterations and additions remains the only village school. Children enter at Infant age and leave at the end of the School year when they attain the age of eleven. They continue their edu- cation in the neighbouring Secondary Schools in Stevenage, travelling by School Bus. Benington School is a for- ward looking school, eagerly taking part in the village community at large. The children, all from Benington, come to school either by car or by walking and after Daily Assembly go to their four classrooms for lessons. The staff consists of Headteacher and three other Class Teachers, the Headteacher herself teaching practically full time. (Cont.)
